conclusion: The particle starts from rest and its acceleration over time follows a triangular wave pattern.
The graph shows acceleration increasing linearly from 0 to a0 until t = t0/2, then decreasing to 0 at t = t0, decreasing to -a0 at t = 3t0/2, and back to 0 at t = 2t0.
Initial velocity and position are zero since the particle starts from rest.
Define a(t) as acceleration, v(t) as velocity, and x(t) as position.
Acceleration a(t) is expressed piecewise for different time intervals.
Integrate acceleration to find velocity for each interval.
For t0/2 < t ≤ t0, express a(t) and integrate to find v(t).
